Uses of Class
com.wizzer.mle.math.MlRotation

    • Uses of MlRotation in com.wizzer.mle.math

      static MlRotation MlRotation.identity()
      Create a null rotation.
      MlRotation MlRotation.inverse()
      Calculates the inverse of a rotation.
      MlRotation MlRotation.invert()
      Changes a rotation to be its inverse.
      MlRotation MlRotation.mul(MlRotation q)
      Multiplies this rotation by another rotation; results in product of rotations.
      MlRotation MlRotation.mul(MlRotation q1, MlRotation q2)
      The binary multiplication of two rotations.
      MlRotation MlRotation.setValue(float[] q)
      Sets the value of the rotation from array of 4 components of a quaternion.
      MlRotation MlRotation.setValue(float q1, float q2, float q3, float q4)
      Sets the value of the rotation from 4 individual components of a quaternion.
      MlRotation MlRotation.setValue(MlTransform m)
      Sets the value of the rotation from a transform matrix.
      MlRotation MlRotation.setValue(MlVector3 axis, float radians)
      Sets the value of the rotation from 3D rotation axis vector and angle in radians.
      MlRotation MlRotation.setValue(MlVector3 rotateFrom, MlVector3 rotateTo)
      Sets rotation to rotate from one direction vector to another.
      MlRotation MlRotation.slerp(MlRotation rot0, MlRotation rot1, float t)
      Spherical linear interpolation: as t goes from 0 to 1, returned value goes from rot0 to rot1.

      Equality comparison.
      boolean MlRotation.equals(MlRotation q, float tolerance)
      Equality comparison operator within given tolerance - the square of the length of the maximum distance between the two vectors.

      MlRotation MlRotation.slerp(MlRotation rot0, MlRotation rot1, float t)
